2    |  ** ** Module Header ******************************************************* **
3    |  ** 									     **
4    |  **   Modules Revision 3.0						     **
5    |  **   Providing a flexible user environment				     **
6    |  ** 									     **
7    |  **   File:		cmdSetenv.c					     **
8    |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
9    |  ** 									     **
10   |  **   Authors:	John Furlan, jlf@behere.com				     **
11   |  **		Jens Hamisch, jens@Strawberry.COM			     **
12   |  **		R.K. Owen, <rk@owen.sj.ca.us> or <rkowen@nersc.gov>	     **
13   |  ** 									     **
14   |  **   Description: 	The routines for setting and unsetting environment   **
15   |  **			variables from within modulefiles.		     **
16   |  ** 									     **
17   |  **   Exports:		cmdSetEnv					     **
18   |  **			cmdUnsetEnv					     **
19   |  **			moduleSetenv					     **
20   |  **			moduleUnsetenv					     **
21   |  ** 									     **
22   |  **   Notes:								     **
23   |  ** 									     **
24   |  ** ************************************************************************ **

73   | 
74   | /*++++
75   |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
76   |  ** 									     **
77   |  **   Function:		cmdSetEnv					     **
78   |  ** 									     **
79   |  **   Description:	Callback function for the 'setenv' command	     **
80   |  ** 									     **
81   |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
82   |  ** 									     **
83   |  **   Parameters:	ClientData	 client_data			     **
84   |  **			Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
85   |  **			int		 objc		Number of arguments  **
86   |  **			Tcl_Obj		*objv[]		Argument array	     **
87   |  ** 									     **
88   |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
89   |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
90   |  ** 									     **
91   |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
92   |  **					this function is called in order to  **
93   |  **					control everything		     **
94   |  ** 									     **
95   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
96   |  ++++*/
97   | 
98   | int cmdSetEnv(
99   | 	ClientData client_data,
100  | 	Tcl_Interp * interp,
101  | 	int objc,
102  | 	Tcl_Obj * CONST84 objv[]
103  | ) {
104  | 	int             force;		/** Force removale of variables	     **/
105  | 	char           *arg;		/** argument ptr		     **/
106  | 	char           *var;		/** Varibales name		     **/
107  | 	char           *val;		/** Varibales value		     **/
108  |     /**
109  |      **  Check parameters. Usage is:  [-force] variable value
110  |      **/
111  | 	if (objc < 3 || objc > 4) {
112  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_USAGE, LOC, Tcl_GetString(objv[0]),
113  | 				      "[-force] variable value", NULL))
114  | 			return (TCL_ERROR);
115  | 					/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
116  | 	}
117  |     /**
118  |      **  Get variables name and value from the argument array
119  |      **/
120  | 	arg = Tcl_GetString(objv[1]);
121  | 	if (*arg == '-') {
122  | 		if (!strncmp(arg, "-force", 6)) {
123  | 			force = 1;
124  | 			var = Tcl_GetString(objv[2]);
125  | 			val = Tcl_GetString(objv[3]);
126  | 		} else {
127  | 			if (OK !=
128  | 			    ErrorLogger(ERR_USAGE, LOC, Tcl_GetString(objv[0]),
129  | 					"[-force] variable value", NULL))
130  | 				return (TCL_ERROR); /** -- EXIT (FAILURE) -> **/
131  | 		}
132  | 	} else {
133  | 		force = 0;
134  | 		var = Tcl_GetString(objv[1]);
135  | 		val = Tcl_GetString(objv[2]);
136  | 	}
137  | 
138  | 	moduleSetenv(interp, var, val, force);
139  | 
140  |     /**
141  |      **  This has to be done after everything has been set because the
142  |      **  variables may be needed later in the modulefile.
143  |      **/
144  | 
145  | 	if (g_flags & M_DISPLAY) {
146  | 		fprintf(stderr, "%s\t\t ", Tcl_GetString(objv[0]));
147  | 		while (--objc)
148  | 			fprintf(stderr, "%s ", Tcl_GetString(*++objv));
149  | 		fprintf(stderr, "\n");
150  | 	}
151  | 
152  | 	return (TCL_OK);
153  | 
154  | } /** End of 'cmdSetEnv' **/
155  | 
156  | /*++++
157  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
158  |  ** 									     **
159  |  **   Function:		moduleSetenv					     **
160  |  ** 									     **
161  |  **   Description:	Set or unset environment variables		     **
162  |  ** 									     **
163  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
164  |  ** 									     **
165  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
166  |  **			char		*variable	Name of the variable **
167  |  **			char		*value		Value to be set	     **
168  |  **			int		 force		Force removal	     **
169  |  ** 									     **
170  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
171  |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
172  |  ** 									     **
173  |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
174  |  **					this function is called in order to  **
175  |  **					control everything		     **
176  |  ** 									     **
177  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
178  |  ++++*/
179  | 
180  | int	moduleSetenv(	Tcl_Interp	*interp,
181  |              		char		*variable,
182  |              		char		*value,
183  |              		int  		 force)
184  | {
185  |     char	*oldval;			/** Old value of 'variable'  **/
186  | 
187  |     oldval = (char *) Tcl_GetVar2( interp, "env", variable, TCL_GLOBAL_ONLY);
188  |   
189  |     /**
190  |      **  Check to see if variable is already set correctly... 
191  |      **/
192  |     if( !(g_flags & (M_REMOVE|M_DISPLAY|M_SWITCH|M_NONPERSIST)) && oldval) {
193  |         if( !strcmp( value, oldval)) {
194  |             return( TCL_OK);		/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
195  |         }
196  |     }
197  | 
198  |     /**
199  |      **  If I'm in SWSTATE1, I'm removing stuff from the old modulefile, so
200  |      **  I'll just mark the variables that were used with the SWSTATE1 flag and
201  |      **  return.
202  |      **
203  |      **  When I come back through in SWSTATE2, I'm setting the variables that
204  |      **  are in the new modulefile.  So, I'll keep track of these by marking
205  |      **  them as touched by SWSTATE2 and then actually setting their values in
206  |      **  the environment down below.
207  |      **
208  |      **  Finally, in SWSTATE3, I'll check to see if the variables in the old
209  |      **  modulefiles that have been marked are still marked as SWSTATE1.  If
210  |      **  they are still the same, then I'll just unset them and return.
211  |      **
212  |      **  And, if I'm not doing any switching, then just unset the variable if
213  |      **  I'm in remove mode. 
214  |      **/
215  | 
216  |     if( g_flags & M_SWSTATE1) {
217  | 	mhash_add(markVariableHashTable, variable, M_SWSTATE1);
218  |         return( TCL_OK);		/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
219  |     } else if( g_flags & M_SWSTATE2) {
220  | 	mhash_add(markVariableHashTable, variable, M_SWSTATE2);
221  |     } else if( g_flags & M_SWSTATE3) {
222  |         intptr_t marked_val;
223  |         marked_val = (intptr_t) mhash_value(markVariableHashTable, variable);
224  |         if( marked_val) {
225  |             if( marked_val == M_SWSTATE1)
226  |                 return( moduleUnsetenv(interp, variable));	/** -------> **/
227  |             else
228  | 		return( TCL_OK);	/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
229  |         }
230  |     } else if( (g_flags & M_REMOVE) && !force) {
231  | 	return( moduleUnsetenv( interp, variable));		/** -------> **/
232  |     }
233  | 
234  |     /**
235  |      **  Keep track of our changes just in case we have to bail out and restore
236  |      **  the environment.
237  |      **/
238  | 
239  |     if( !(g_flags & (M_NONPERSIST | M_DISPLAY | M_WHATIS | M_HELP))) {
240  |         mhash_add(setenvHashTable, variable, value);
241  |         mhash_del(unsetenvHashTable, variable);
242  |     }
243  | 
244  |     /**
245  |      **  Store the value into the environment
246  |      **/
247  | 
248  |     Tcl_SetVar2( interp, "env", variable, value, TCL_GLOBAL_ONLY);
249  | 
250  |     return( TCL_OK);
251  | 
252  | } /** End of 'moduleSetenv' **/
253  | 
254  | /*++++
255  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
256  |  ** 									     **
257  |  **   Function:		cmdUnsetEnv					     **
258  |  ** 									     **
259  |  **   Description:	Callback function for the 'unset' command	     **
260  |  ** 									     **
261  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
262  |  ** 									     **
263  |  **   Parameters:	ClientData	 client_data			     **
264  |  **			Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
265  |  **			int		 objc		Number of arguments  **
266  |  **			Tcl_Obj		*objv[]		Argument array	     **
267  |  ** 									     **
268  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
269  |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
270  |  ** 									     **
271  |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
272  |  **					this function is called in order to  **
273  |  **					control everything		     **
274  |  ** 									     **
275  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
276  |  ++++*/
277  | 
278  | int cmdUnsetEnv(
279  | 	ClientData client_data,
280  | 	Tcl_Interp * interp,
281  | 	int objc,
282  | 	Tcl_Obj * CONST84 objv[]
283  | ) {
284  |     /**
285  |      **  Parameter check. The name of the variable has to be specified
286  |      **/
287  | 	if (objc < 2 || objc > 3) {
288  | 		if (OK !=
289  | 		    ErrorLogger(ERR_USAGE, LOC, Tcl_GetString(objv[0]),
290  | 				"variable [value]", NULL))
291  | 			return (TCL_ERROR); /** ------ EXIT (FAILURE) -----> **/
292  | 	}
293  |     /**
294  |      **  Non-persist mode?
295  |      **/
296  | 	if (g_flags & M_NONPERSIST) {
297  | 		return (TCL_OK);
298  | 	}
299  |     /**
300  |      **  Unset the variable or just display what to do ...
301  |      **/
302  | 	if (g_flags & M_DISPLAY) {
303  | 		fprintf(stderr, "%s\t ", Tcl_GetString(objv[0]));
304  | 		while (--objc)
305  | 			fprintf(stderr, "%s ", Tcl_GetString(*++objv));
306  | 		fprintf(stderr, "\n");
307  | 	} else if (g_flags & M_REMOVE && objc == 3) {
308  | 		int             save_flags = g_flags;
309  | 	/** allow an optional 3rd argument to set the env.var. to on removal **/
310  | 		g_flags = (g_flags & ~M_REMOVE) | M_LOAD;
311  | 		moduleSetenv(interp, Tcl_GetString(objv[1]),
312  | 			     Tcl_GetString(objv[2]), 0);
313  | 		g_flags = save_flags;
314  | 	} else {
315  | 		moduleUnsetenv(interp, Tcl_GetString(objv[1]));
316  | 	}
317  |     /**
318  |      **  Return on success
319  |      **/
320  | 
321  | 	return (TCL_OK);
322  | 
323  | } /** End of 'cmdUnsetEnv' **/
324  | 
325  | /*++++
326  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
327  |  ** 									     **
328  |  **   Function:		moduleUnsetenv					     **
329  |  ** 									     **
330  |  **   Description:	Unset environment variables			     **
331  |  ** 									     **
332  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
333  |  ** 									     **
334  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
335  |  **			char		*variable	Name of the variable **
336  |  ** 									     **
337  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
338  |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
339  |  ** 									     **
340  |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
341  |  **					this function is called in order to  **
342  |  **					control everything		     **
343  |  ** 									     **
344  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
345  |  ++++*/
346  | 
347  | int	moduleUnsetenv(	Tcl_Interp	*interp,
348  |              		char		*variable)
349  | {
350  |     /**
351  |      ** Don't unset the variable in Tcl Space.
352  |      ** If module writer *REALLY* wants it gone, use $env
353  |      **/
354  | 
355  |     if( !(g_flags & (M_NONPERSIST | M_DISPLAY | M_WHATIS | M_HELP))) {
356  |         mhash_add(unsetenvHashTable, variable, NULL);
357  |         mhash_del(setenvHashTable, variable);
358  |     }
359  | 
360  |     return( TCL_OK);
361  | 
362  | } /** end of 'moduleUnsetenv' **/
363  |
